oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jefferson Street Bridge over Cumberland River, Nashville, Tenn., circa 1911
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A color postcard of the Jefferson Street Bridge on the Cumberland River in Nashville, Tennessee, showing its metal truss design. No longer extant, the bridge was demolished in 1990 to make way for a new Jefferson Street Bridge that could handle more traffic. Forms part of the Nashville Room Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
